events.description: Pegasus spyware is used to monitor and track journalists, human rights activists, and dissidents globally.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: A two-part investigation was launched in collaboration with Forbidden Films.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: NSO was established with the ambition to make the world a safer place, developing powerful spyware.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Pegasus is described as a military weapon used against civilians, raising serious concerns for democracies.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: There is no control over how countries use Pegasus, and it has been used in the worst imaginable ways.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Frontline presents part one of the Global Spyware Scandal, exposing Pegasus.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Phones are viewed as computers and extensions of our body, capable of being turned into surveillance devices beyond George Orwell's imagination.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Pegasus technology is far ahead of government regulation and public understanding.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: It was suspected that NSO Group's powerful surveillance instrument would be abused by authoritarian regimes.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: A joint investigation by 17 news outlets including The Washington Post, The Guardian, and Le Monde, revealed targets.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Lawyers and journalists are reportedly among those targeted by phone numbers belonging to big-name politicians.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: The discovered list contains about 50,000 phone numbers from 2016 to 2020.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Officially, Pegasus spyware is not supposed to work on US phone numbers.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Most targeted numbers are in 10 countries, whose governments are known clients of NSO Group.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Pegasus infects iPhones and Androids, extracting and accessing everything from the device, including encrypted messages, mic, and camera.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Once a phone is infected by Pegasus, the user is 'trapped'.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Journalists from The Washington Post, The Guardian, and other outlets decided to collaborate on the investigation.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: The initial list had no names, necessitating more journalists, on-the-ground reporters, and tech expertise.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: The quantity of phone numbers, tens of thousands, was shocking to the journalists.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: The data concerned individuals in India, Mexico, Hungary, Azerbaijan, and Kazakhstan.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Forbidden Stories' data identifying NSO customers and targets is considered a 'game changer' for understanding cyber surveillance.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: The Guardian has been reporting on NSO for a long time and emphasized holding the company accountable.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Israel has become a world leader in the surveillance industry, with NSO Group being a 'jewel in the crown'.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: NSO Group was recently valued at $1 billion and is one of Israel's most successful startups.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: NSO claims to sell software to governments for legitimate purposes like fighting terrorism and violating local laws.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: NSO claims only three cases of misuse in 10 years, leading to systems being shut down completely.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: NSO states it only sells to governments or entities believed not to misuse tools, with diligence mechanisms in place.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Journalists gathered in Paris during the COVID crisis to plan the investigation.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Journalists from rival organizations adopted a partnership model for this investigation, working as one group with one goal.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: More than 80 journalists worked on the project, with a publication date set for July 2021.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: The main task was to identify names behind the phone numbers, which was crucial for the project.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Proving Pegasus was on phones required forensic analysis.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Claudio Guarnieri, head of Amnesty International's Security Lab, created a methodology for phone analysis.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Guarnieri's expertise was key to detecting Pegasus traces.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Pegasus accesses files, records (WhatsApp, SMS), GPS, audio, and webcam on devices.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Digital security against Pegasus is challenging, with limited ability to stop it meaningfully.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Crucial information was discovered regarding Jamal Khashoggi.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Jamal Khashoggi was killed in 2018 in a Saudi consulate in Istanbul.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Two phone numbers associated with women closest to Jamal Khashoggi were found on the list.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Jamal Khashoggi was an opinion writer for The Washington Post and a key dissident against the Saudi regime.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Khashoggi compared the Saudi Crown Prince to Putin and Iran's supreme leader, describing his rule as a dictatorship.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Saudi intellectuals and journalists are currently jailed.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Jamal Khashoggi's murder was cold-blooded, and the full story is still unknown.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: The investigation into Pegasus is described as a two-part collaboration with Forbidden Films.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: NSO was established to make the world safer but developed powerful spyware, Pegasus.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Pegasus is characterized as a military weapon used against civilians globally, with no control over its use by countries.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: The power of Pegasus is described as 'intoxicating' due to its ability to infiltrate most people's phones undetected.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Pegasus allows surveillance of emails, encrypted communication, and everything a user sees or watches.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: The spyware was used against civil society members, not just terrorists or criminals, suggesting a 'free-for-all'.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: A joint investigation by 17 news outlets, including The Washington Post, The Guardian, and Le Monde, along with Forbidden Stories, revealed widespread targeting.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: NSO claims its software is sold to governments for legitimate purposes like fighting terrorism, but it's seen as a 'go-to spy service for tyrants'.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Former French minister François de Rugy was identified as a target, with his phone analysis confirming he was targeted by the Kingdom of Morocco.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: It was revealed that a total of 14 current or former ministers were among those targeted.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: François de Rugy's meeting with the King of Morocco is suggested as a reason for his targeting.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Emmanuel Macron's phone number was found on the list, and an SMS was sent to confirm its activity.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Élysée services responded to the SMS, confirming the President received it and the phone was active.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: An invitation to the Élysée was received from state services to discuss the findings.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: The meeting at the Élysée conveyed a sense of 'panic' regarding the potential judicial, diplomatic, and security implications of the affair.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: State experts confirmed attempts or actual infections on phones of several French ministers and high-ranking officials.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: The analysis results of the French President's phone were classified as 'secret defense' and made inaccessible.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Moroccan dissidents and even the King of Morocco were on the Pegasus list.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: NSO sells its technology exclusively to governments and government agencies.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: The investigation moved into a 'dangerous space' by discussing one country attacking another using this technology.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: The use of NSO Group's technology reveals insights into the nature of the client government.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Princess Latifa, daughter of Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum of Dubai, was unhappy and incarcerated by her father's regime.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Princess Latifa recorded a video stating her father would 'kill people to protect his own reputation'.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Princess Latifa attempted an escape involving jet skis, a yacht, and a trip to the Indian Ocean.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Princess Latifa's phone number was entered into the Pegasus list the day after she went missing from Dubai.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Phone numbers of her friends and associates also appeared on the list as she traveled.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Eight days after her escape, Indian special forces boarded the yacht, and Princess Latifa was forcibly returned to Dubai.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: NSO's technology appears to have been one of the tools used by the state in a 'desperate attempt' to find and kidnap Princess Latifa.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: David Haigh's phone, a key figure in the Latifa case, showed Pegasus activity.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: David Haigh was infected with Pegasus on August 3, 2020, even while on British soil.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: David Haigh founded 'Detained International' and the 'campaign to free the Dubai Princess, Princess Latifa'.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Princess Latifa messaged David Haigh after her failed escape attempt.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Princess Latifa drew pictures of her 'jail villa,' Villa 96 in Jumeirah, Dubai, describing her captivity conditions.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: Her contact with Latifa abruptly stopped the week before David Haigh was hacked.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: David Haigh had 'dynamite evidence' on his phone, including videos from Latifa, which was intended for media.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: The constant threat of being listened to and watched is a daily fear for those targeted.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: There's a call for accountability to prevent NSO and abusive governments from continuing their actions, warning that inaction will lead to worsening future abuses by other companies.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: NSO's core strength lies in 'vulnerability researchers' who find ways to overcome sophisticated systems like the iPhone.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

events.description: There is a mechanism for recruiting graduates from Israeli army computer unit 8200, which deals with 'offensive cyber' for the Israel Defense Forces, into civilian high-tech.
events.source_video_title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part Two (full documentary) | FRONTLINE
